sections.why_your_lawn_needs_this: Nutrients designed to improve grass's heat stress tolerance during the summer months.
sections.whats_included:
Lawn Aid : seaweed extract in this preventative fertilizer cultivates greener grass, density and strong roots, while potassium increases heat and drought tolerance. works to keep moisture in your drought-stressed yard. 42 fl. oz. pouch. Covers up to 3,000 sq. ft. Check out our Lawn Aid instructions here.
Water Focus: With surfactant for water retention, slow-release nitrogen for sustained growth, potassium for better water management, and molasses to stimulate soil microbes, Water Focus lawn fertilizer helps you grow green grass in a planet-friendly way. 42 fl. oz. pouch. Covers up to 5,000 sq. ft. Check out our Water focus instructions here.
Dandelion Doom Herbicide Concentrate : Kills weeds down to the root effectively on broadleaf weeds including: broadleaf plantain, bull thistle, creeping buttercup, dandelion, false dandelion, moss, oxalis, Persian Speedwell, prostrate knotweed, white clover and more. 5 oz. concentrate bottle. Treats up to 224 sq. ft. Check out our Dandelion Doom instructions here .
Herbicide Pouch + Sprayer: Reusable, easy-fill gallon pouch and premium battery-powered wand sprayer. 1 gallon concentrate pouch + Powerhouse™ wand sprayer.
Hose end sprayer: reusable and designed to deliver the right ratio of water and Sunday nutrients.
sections.faq:
In what order should I use products?
Tackle your weeds first with Dandelion Doom. In general, you should avoid applying nutrients to untreated weeds as this may boost their growth. Note: When switching to Sunday from traditional herbicides, you may require a few applications to kill weeds entirely. After weeds are treated, wait at least 24 hours then apply your Sunday nutrients. Apply Water Focus first and then apply Lawn Aid two weeks later for best results.
What do I need to know when applying lawn nutrients?
Only apply to actively growing grass and ensure your lawn is sufficiently hydrated before application. Do not apply when heavy rain is expected.These pouches can be used in combination with your Smart Lawn plan. We recommend waiting 2 to 4 weeks between nutrient applications for best results.
When is it safe for people and pets to go on my lawn after applying?
Our ingredients break down quickly and get to work on your grass and soil. After our products dry, you can get back to playing outside right away!
Where can I apply this product?
Liquid nutrients are appropriate for all of the most commonly grown residential turfgrasses. It’s not formulated for golf course favorites such as colonial bentgrass and creeping bentgrass.
When is the best time to apply Dandelion Doom?
Wait until temps are between 50 and 85 degrees, then spray dry plants from a close distance until drenched. Wait 20-30 minutes, then pull and dispose of remains. Avoid applying if you’re expecting rain within 3 hours. Repeat every 2-3 weeks to control new growth.
Can I use it on my lawn?
Yes! Dandelion Doom is a selective herbicide, meaning that it will kill most broadleaf weeds but not grass, so it is safe to use on your lawn.
How do you apply concentrates?
Use your outside hose to fill the sprayer up to the 1-gallon mark. Pour in a full 5 oz. bottle of Dandelion Doom concentrate into the reusable pouch and attach the wand sprayer. Firmly reattach the lid of the reusable pouch and mix slowly. Apply to broadleaf weeds within your lawn. Do not spray on rocks, concrete or other hard surfaces.
How long do the concentrates last?
The concentrates have a shelf life of approximately two years. After the initial mixing, you will want to make sure it is mixed well again if it sits for 30, or more, days.
What's the coverage area for the concentrates?
Our herbicide concentrates can cover approximately 224 sq. ft. and should be applied to your existing weeds. The coverage area is the total square footage of the weeds themselves, not necessarily the entire lawn.
What’s in it and how does it work?
The active ingredient, iron, is toxic to broadleaf weeds in high doses. Because grass has a much higher iron tolerance, it doesn't get damaged. The areas where you spray may turn a dark green/gray/black color after spraying, but this doesn’t mean the grass will die.
Does Dandelion Doom work on anything else?
Good news! The iron in Dandelion Doom also suppresses lawn diseases such as Dollar Spot, rust, snow mold, and more.
